title: Convert Speed to Meters per Second
text: First, convert the speed from $$105$$ $$\frac{km}{h}$$ to $$\frac{m}{s}$$, what is v $$=$$ \frac{105 , \text{km/h} \times $$1000$$ , \text{m/km}}{3600 , \text{s/h}}?

title: Use the Formula for the Ideal Banking Angle
text: The ideal banking angle θ for a curve of radius $$r$$ and speed v is given by tan(θ) $$=$$ $$\frac{v^2}{r} g$$. Then take the arctangent to find 𝜃.
